headline.main: HIT WRUL BALKING SHORT-WAVE PACT; Federal Agencies Lay Refusal to Sign Contract to Demand for 'a Substantial Profit'

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 -- The refusal of WRUL, a short-wave radio station in Boston, to sign a leasing contract with the government for use of the Office of War Information and the Coordinator of Inter-American Affairs evoked sharp comment from those agencies today.
abstract: OWI, Inter-Amer Affairs Coordinator Office, and FCC score WRUL action; Lemmon and Dr H Shapley defend action
